title: Should I file for bankruptcy?
question: I currently owe approximately $50k to the IRS and have about $15k-$20k in debt which I'm currently paying back through a debt consolidation payment plan. I also own a home which I'm selling and have about $100k in equity in it. I also make about $100k-$120k a year. Should I file for bankruptcy or find a tax attorney?
answers: Consult a tax professional and BK attorney, first. You may not be a good candidate for an offer-in-compromise based on your income, unless you have large acceptable expenses. Good luck.
Find a tax attorney. Your debts are not that significant given your assets and income.

2 points. First there is not enough information about your tax debt to know if it is dischargeable in bankruptcy. Second, While I am not a bankruptcy attorney, you may not pass the means test to have your debts discharged in bankruptcy. Quite possibly you are looking at an Installment Agreement with the IRS.

I would need to have specific information on your tax debt and current financial status to determine your best course of action with the IRS.
